wikipedia_page.main: Sir John Harrison Burnett (21 January 1922 – 22 July 2007) was a British botanist and mycologist, who served as the principal and vice chancellor of Edinburgh University from 1979 to 1987.

response: * John Harrison Burnett (1922–2007), British botanist and mycologist

link_mentions.page: List of Principals of the University of Edinburgh

response: * John Harrison Burnett - botanist, chair of Botany at King's College, Newcastle (1960–68)
*John Harrison Burnett, Principal and Vice-Chancellor, University of Edinburgh.
Dr. (now Sir) John Harrison Burnett, Principal of the University commented, when launching the Microbeacon project:

In 1968 he was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh. His proposers were James A. MacDonald, John Harrison Burnett, John Walton and Paul Weatherley. He was President of the Botanical Society of Edinburgh.
